description: From Middle English laumproun, adopted from Old French lampreon, diminutive of lampreie (“lamprey”).

entries.meaning: The European river lamprey, Lampetra fluviatilis.
examples: […]if thou woldest an eel or a laumprun holde with streite hondis, how myche strengerli thou thristis, so myche the sunnere it shal sliden awey.
